docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama is calling 2014 "a year of action" for creating jobs and economic opportunities for American families.

headline.main: On Jobs, Obama Calls 2014 'a Year of Action'
headline.print_headline: On Jobs, Obama Calls 2014 'a Year of Action'

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama is calling 2014 "a year of action" for creating jobs and economic opportunities for American families.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a move that some fear could compromise care for Medicare recipients, the Obama administration is proposing to remove special protections that guarantee seniors access to a wide selection of three types of drugs.

headline.main: Proposed Medicare Drug Change Stirs Access Worries
headline.print_headline: Proposed Medicare Drug Change Stirs Access Worries

docs.snippet: In a move that some fear could compromise care for Medicare recipients, the Obama administration is proposing to remove special protections that guarantee seniors access to a wide selection of three types of drugs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gay couples in Utah have experienced a helter-skelter wave of emotions over the last three weeks: They were suddenly allowed to marry, then saw the weddings stopped by the U.S. Supreme Court and were told the state wouldn't recognize the unions.

headline.main: Feds Side With Same-Sex Couples in Utah
headline.print_headline: Feds Side With Same-Sex Couples in Utah

docs.snippet: Gay couples in Utah have experienced a helter-skelter wave of emotions over the last three weeks: They were suddenly allowed to marry, then saw the weddings stopped by the U.S. Supreme Court and were told the state wouldn't recognize the unions.

docs.lead_paragraph: On the third day without clean tap water, business owners with empty dining rooms and quiet aisles of merchandise around West Virginia's capital were left to wonder how much of an economic hit they'll take from a chemical spill.

headline.main: Chemical Spill a Blow to W.Va. Capital's Economy
headline.print_headline: Chemical Spill a Blow to W.Va. Capital's Economy

docs.snippet: On the third day without clean tap water, business owners with empty dining rooms and quiet aisles of merchandise around West Virginia's capital were left to wonder how much of an economic hit they'll take from a chemical spill.

docs.lead_paragraph: Today is Saturday, Jan. 11, the 11th day of 2014. There are 354 days left in the year.
docs.snippet: Today is Saturday, Jan. 11, the 11th day of 2014. There are 354 days left in the year.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many Americans who signed up through the federal marketplace for health care coverage have yet to receive an insurance card, policy number or bill.

headline.main: Enrollees at Health Exchanges Face Struggle to Prove Coverage
headline.print_headline: Enrollees at Health Exchanges Face Struggle to Prove Coverage

docs.abstract: Patients across the country are having difficulties with insurance policies bought under the health care reform law, which went into effect on Jan 1; in addition to problems many face in proving they have coverage, patients are also having a hard time figuring out which doctors are affiliated with their plans, and often doctors themselves do not know.
docs.snippet: Many Americans who signed up through the federal marketplace for health care coverage have yet to receive an insurance card, policy number or bill.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: Robert Pear reported from Fort Worth, and Abby Goodnough from Washington. Anemona Hartocollis and Reed Abelson contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and ABBY GOODNOUGH

docs.lead_paragraph: The president will begin hosting influential groups to spur action on national problems short of changes to federal law.

headline.main: Obama Counts on Power of Convening People for Change
headline.print_headline: Obama Counts on Power of Convening People for Change

docs.abstract: White House Memo; Pres Obama will begin hosting influential groups at the White House to try to spur specific action on national problems short of changes to federal law, in light of hostility to his agenda from Congressional Republicans.
docs.snippet: The president will begin hosting influential groups to spur action on national problems short of changes to federal law.

docs.lead_paragraph: CGI Federal had come under fire from the Obama administration for the glitches that plagued the rollout of the HealthCare.gov website.

headline.main: Contractor for Health Portal Replaced, but Says ‘We Were Not Fired’
headline.print_headline: Contractor for Health Portal Replaced, but Says ‘We Were Not Fired’

docs.abstract: CGI Federal, contractor hired to build the computer enrollment system for the health care reform law, says it will stop working on the troubled insurance exchange when its contract expires in February 2014; CGI, which was blamed by many in the Obama administration for rollout's computer glitches, insists it was not fired.
docs.snippet: CGI Federal had come under fire from the Obama administration for the glitches that plagued the rollout of the HealthCare.gov website.

docs.lead_paragraph: The bill would require the health department to promptly notify consumers of any possible security breaches on the federal or state exchanges.

headline.main: House Votes to Increase Security Measures on Health Care Exchanges

docs.snippet: The bill would require the health department to promptly notify consumers of any possible security breaches on the federal or state exchanges.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate will consider legislation to revive expired benefits for 1.3 million out-of-work Americans on Monday, but it appears gridlock will continue.

headline.main: Jobs Data Gives Hope for Benefits Extension
headline.print_headline: Jobs Data Gives Hope For Benefits Extension

docs.abstract: News analysis; surprisingly weak December jobs report might have strengthened Democrats’ hand in current fight over emergency jobless benefits for long-term unemployed even as it weakened party in larger midterm election battle; Senate is to consider legislation to revive expired benefits for 1.3 million out-of-work Americans.
docs.snippet: The Senate will consider legislation to revive expired benefits for 1.3 million out-of-work Americans on Monday, but it appears gridlock will continue.

byline.original: By ANNIE LOWREY and JONATHAN WEISMAN
